# drawsBackground

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that indicates if the clip view draws its background color.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var drawsBackground: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

If your [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSClipView] is enclosed in an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSScrollView], you should set the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSClipView/drawsBackground] property on the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSScrollView]. Setting this property to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] on an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSScrollView] has the added effect of setting the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSClipView] property [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSClipView/copiesOnScroll] to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false]. The side effect of setting the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSClipView/drawsBackground] property on the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSClipView] is the appearance of “trails” (vestiges of previous drawing) in the document view as it is scrolled.

## Working with Background Color

- **backgroundColor**: The color of the clip view’s background.
